1.text: The Baldad the Suhite answered, and said:

2.text: How long wilt thou speak these things, and how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a strong wind?

3.text: Doth God pervert judgment, or doth the Almighty overthrow that which is just?

4.text: Although thy children have sinned against him, and he hath left them in the hand of their iniquity:

5.text: Yet if thou wilt arise early to God, and wilt beseech the Almighty:

6.text: If thou wilt walk clean and upright, he will presently awake onto thee, and will make the dwelling of thy justice peaceable:

7.text: Insomuch, that if thy former things were small, thy latter things would be multiplied exceedingly.

8.text: For inquire of the former generation, and search diligently into the memory of the fathers:

9.text: (For we are but of yesterday, and are ignorant that our days upon earth are but a shadow:)

10.text: And they shall teach thee: they shall speak to thee, and utter words out of their hearts.

11.text: Can the rush be green without moisture? or a sedge-bush grow without water?

12.text: When it is yet in flower, and is not plucked up with the hand, it withereth before all herbs.

13.text: Even so are the ways of all that forget God, and the hope of the hypocrite shall perish:

14.text: His folly shall not please him, and his trust shall be like the spiderâ€™s web.

15.text: He shall lean upon his house, and it shall not stand: he shall prop it up, and it shall not rise:

16.text: He seemeth to have moisture before the sun cometh, and at his rising his blossom shall shoot forth.

17.text: His roots shall be thick upon a heap of stones, and among the stones he shall abide.

18.text: If one swallow him up out of his place, he shall deny him, and shall say: I know thee not.

19.text: For this is the joy of his way, that others may spring again out of the earth.

20.text: God will not cast away the simple, nor reach out his hand to the evildoer:

21.text: Until thy mouth be filled with laughter, and thy lips with rejoicing.

22.text: They that hate thee, shall be clothed with confusion: and the dwelling of the wicked shall not stand.
